subject: Learning
title: The Global Right to Education
description: A quick win: understand The Global Right to Education.

hook.text: In 1948, the United Nations declared education a fundamental human right. Millions still lack access.

buildup.text: Article 26 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights guarantees free, compulsory elementary education.

discovery.text: Since then, global primary enrollment rose from 50% to over 90%â€”the fastest expansion in history.

twist.text: But enrollment isn't learning. Over 250 million children attend school yet can't read a simple sentence.

climax.text: The next frontier isn't accessâ€”it's quality. A seat in a classroom is meaningless without real teaching.

punchline.text: The right to education means nothing without the right to learn.

quiz.question: What challenge remains despite rising global school enrollment?
options: Millions attend school but still can't read or do basic math
Every child in the world now receives quality education
Enrollment rates have been declining since 1948
